title: Advent's Cobham takeover backed by former defence ministers
text:
Advent’s £4bn bid for Cobham has won the backing of two former defence ministers who argue that a sale to the US private equity firm could boost the British business.

Former defence secretary Sir Michael Fallon and former defence procurement minister Philip Dunne said they supported Advent’s bid for Dorset-based Cobham.

The US private equity firm's bid for Cobham has met fierce resistance from Britain's security establishment, with claims that a sale could risk national security.

Former MI6 head Sir John Sawers has urged the government to block the deal, and Business Secretary Andrea Leadsom is considering an intervention.
